alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 4:56PM CDT until June 07 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: .Rain across the area will continue to tapper off through 7 pm and any ponding water will recede. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Lawrence and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Loretto, Collinwood, Clifton, St. Joseph, Westpoint, Iron City and Lutts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
